org.pepstock.charba.client.items

Class NativeJsItemsHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pepstock.charba.client.items.NativeJsItemsHelper

  • @JsType(isNative=true,
        name="CharbaJsItemsHelper",
        namespace="<global>")
final class NativeJsItemsHelper
extends Object
    Java native object which is wrapping a CHARBA java script object implementation with some utilities to act on java script objects for CHARBA items.
    Author:
    Andrea "Stock" Stocchero

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NativeJsItemsHelper()
      To avoid any instantiation

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) static double getBasePixel(NativeObject scale)
      Returns the pixel for the minimum chart value.
      The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
      (package private) static double getBaseValue(NativeObject scale)
      Returns the minimum chart value
      (package private) static NativeObject getDatasetControllerStyle(NativeObject controller, int dataIndex)
      Returns a set of predefined style properties that should be used to represent the dataset or the data if the index is specified.
      (package private) static double getDecimalForPixel(NativeObject scale, double pixel)
      Used to get the data value from a given pixel.
      This is the inverse of getPixelForValue.
      The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
      (package private) static String getLabelForValue(NativeObject scale, double value)
      Used to get the label to display in the tooltip for the given value.
      (package private) static double getPixelForDecimal(NativeObject scale, double decimal)
      Utility for getting the pixel location of a percentage of scale.
      The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
      (package private) static double getPixelForStringValue(NativeObject scale, String value, double index)
      Returns the location of the given data point as string.
      (package private) static double getPixelForTick(NativeObject scale, double index)
      Returns the location of the tick at the given index.
      The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
      (package private) static double getPixelForValue(NativeObject scale, double value, double index)
      Returns the location of the given data point.
      Value can either be an index or a numerical value.
      The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
      (package private) static double getValueForPixel(NativeObject scale, double pixel)
      Used to get the data value from a given pixel.
      This is the inverse of getPixelForValue.
      The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
      (package private) static boolean isCanvasGradient(Object object, String key)
      Returns true if the property in the native object is a CanvasGradientItem.
      (package private) static boolean isCanvasPattern(Object object, String key)
      Returns true if the property in the native object is a CanvasPatternItem.

      • getDecimalForPixel

        static double getDecimalForPixel(NativeObject scale,
                                 double pixel)
        Used to get the data value from a given pixel.
        This is the inverse of getPixelForValue.
        The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        scale - scale native object instance
        pixel - pixel value
        Returns:
        the data value from a given pixel

        Parameters:

        decimal - number value to use
        Returns:

      • getPixelForValue

        static double getPixelForValue(NativeObject scale,
                               double value,
                               double index)
        Returns the location of the given data point.
        Value can either be an index or a numerical value.
        The coordinate (0, 0) is at the upper-left corner of the canvas.
        Parameters:
        scale - scale native object instance
        value - value of the data
        index - index of the data
        Returns:
        the location of the given data point
